articles.author: Laila Bassam, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Israel's Mossad spy agency planted a small amount of explosives inside 5,000 Taiwan-made pagers ordered by Lebanese group Hezbollah months before Tuesday's detonations, a senior Lebanese security source and another source told Reuters.
articles.title: Israel planted explosives in Hezbollah's Taiwan-made pagers, say sources

articles.author: Laila Bassam, Tom Perry
articles.description: Lebanon's Hezbollah was bracing for the risk of Israeli military escalation when its old foe struck a blow it hadn't seen coming, plunging the Iran-backed group into hours of unprecedented disarray, sources familiar with Hezbollah operations say.
articles.title: Pager attack throws Hezbollah into disarray

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Wednesday that his "Victory Plan", intended to bring peace to Ukraine while keeping the country strong an avoiding all "frozen conflicts", was now complete after much consultation.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy says 'victory plan' is ready

articles.author: David Ljunggren
articles.description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau looks set to survive a confidence vote next week after a rival party said on Wednesday it would not back an attempt to defeat his minority Liberal government.
articles.title: Trudeau set to survive confidence vote next week with opposition support

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iranian cyber actors sent messages during the summer to people involved in President Joe Biden's then re-election campaign containing non-public material from Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump's campaign as part of efforts to influence the Nov. 5 election, U.S. agencies said on Wednesday.
articles.title: US says Iran tried to influence election with messages to Biden camp

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Haiti's government on Wednesday created a provisional electoral council, an initial step needed to hold the Caribbean nation's first general elections since 2016.
articles.title: Haiti creates council to hold first elections since 2016

articles.author: Jack Queen
articles.description: Harvey Weinstein pleaded not guilty to committing a criminal sexual act on Wednesday, nearly five months after the disgraced Hollywood movie mogul's sex crimes conviction in New York was overturned.
articles.title: Harvey Weinstein pleads not guilty to committing a criminal sexual act

articles.author: Miguel Pereira, Guillermo Martinez
articles.description: A wave of deadly wildfires in Portugal has pushed emergency services to the limit and much-needed reinforcements arrived on Wednesday from Spain and Morocco, authorities said, as cooler weather also brought a glimmer of hope.
articles.title: Beset by wildfires, Portugal gets help from Spain, Morocco

articles.author: Riham Alkousaa
articles.description: Germany has put a hold on new exports of weapons of war to Israel while it deals with legal challenges, according to a Reuters analysis of data and a source close to the Economy Ministry.
articles.title: Exclusive: Germany has stopped approving war weapons exports to Israel, source says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: In Brazil, a man from the Guarani community was shot dead on Wednesday morning, a governmental protection agency for Indigenous communities said, as a land dispute in the farm state of Mato Grosso do Sul escalated.
articles.title: Indigenous man shot dead as land dispute in Brazil farm state escalates
